message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static void main(String[] args) {
    String input = "Open_filedesc_count:mix:-1:-1:longterm:HML Max_filedesc_count:mix:-1:-1:longterm:HML,Percent_usage:mix:-1:95/90/85:standard:HML, Availability:mix:1/-/-:-1";
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, ":,-");
    StringBuilder output = new StringBuilder();

    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String token = st.nextToken();
        if (!token.contains("_")) {
            output.append(token);
        }
    }

    System.out.println(output.toString());
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we create a StringTokenizer object with the input string and specify the delimiters as ":" and "-". Then, we iterate through the tokens using the hasMoreTokens() method and check if the token contains an underscore "_". If it does not contain an underscore, we append it to a StringBuilder object called "output". Finally, we print the contents of the StringBuilder object, which will be the desired output.
